chapter.title: PIM Domain

warning.para: This page is only a proposal! This means that everyone is allowed to edit this page and it is marked for change. This proposal could be seen as design idea and should be discussed in public and visible for everyone before implemented at all.

chapter.para: This proposal is about an additional domain at the engineering service bus. The domain is responsible for connecting a range of personal information management systems (PIM). Generally there could be thought about tasks, persons, calendars, time-tracking and so on. Mostly I think in the direction of the KDE Akonadi project, but not as a local common datastore, more as a global sync server. This means we have to implement a wide range of different protocols and connectors. Very interesting connectors could be gcal (calendar), gmail (contacts), rtm (tasks), direct mailer integration, which means global icals file (mail), "pseudo" ldap server (contacts), and maybe some additional protocols. This would allow developers to have access to all his tasks, mettings, persons of the project and so on in his own environment. He could use google, rtm, outlook, kontact, evolution, imacthingihavenoideaandiamnotinterestedinhowthisthingisnamed and so on. He could close tasks, add comments to tasks which will be attached to issue tracker issues, he'll automatically see if a project manager changes a milestone, and many many other advantages.
